thread.title: Manchester United fan claims he forced Liverpool to change Twitter bio ahead of Red Devils' EFL Cup final win
thread.title_full: Manchester United fan claims he forced Liverpool to change Twitter bio ahead of Red Devils' EFL Cup final win

author: James Whaling
title: Manchester United fan claims he forced Liverpool to change Twitter bio ahead of Red Devils' EFL Cup final win
text:
Sport Manchester United fan claims he forced Liverpool to change Twitter bio ahead of Red Devils' EFL Cup final win Liverpool proudly boasted that they were the most successful club in England with 41 major honours... until Sunday Share Get   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Manchester United fan has claimed he forced Liverpool to change their Twitter bio ahead of the Red Devils' EFL Cup final win. 
Liverpool proudly boasted that they were the most successful club in England with 41 major honours. 
But United's victory over Southampton moved them level with their fiercest rivals. 
A fan had tweeted earlier in the week that the Reds would have to alter their bio if United were victorious at Wembley. 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic's brace and a strike from Jesse Lingard ensured a 3-2 win under the arch, and sure enough Liverpool changed their description. Liverpool were forced to change their Twitter bio (Photo: ) 
The Reds' 41 honours are made up of 18 league titles, seven FA Cups, eight League Cups, five European Cups and three UEFA Cups. 
United have restored parity with the Anfield giants virtue of their fifth League Cup triumph. 
They add to 20 league titles, 12 FA Cups, three European Cups and a Cup Winner's Cup. Zlatan proved the difference for United (Photo: Getty) United won the EFL Cup (Photo: The FA Collection) 
Ibrahimovic proved the difference at Wembley as he haded home Ander Herrera's late cross to secure the first major piece of silverware of the season would be heading to Old Trafford. 
He had earlier given United the lead with a sumptuous free-kick after Manolo Gabbiadini had a perfectly good strike ruled out for Southampton. 
Jesse Lingard doubled the Red Devils' advantage before Gabbiadini's double restored parity, and Zlatan netted the winner. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
